markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Weapon 0"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Scythe](/Weapons.aspx?ID=394)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Deadly d10" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=174" />
<trait label="Trip" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=196" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 278 <sup>2.0</sup>

**Favored Weapon** [Aonaurious](/Deities.aspx?ID=581), [Apollyon](/Deities.aspx?ID=390), [Atrogine](/Deities.aspx?ID=331), [Immaculate Growth](/Deities.aspx?ID=364), [Jaidi](/Deities.aspx?ID=406), [Magdh](/Deities.aspx?ID=457), [Urgathoa](/Deities.aspx?ID=295), [Vermilion Mother](/Deities.aspx?ID=602), [Vonymos](/Deities.aspx?ID=553), [Zibik](/Deities.aspx?ID=685)

<row gap="medium">
**Price** 2 gp

**Damage** 1d10 S

**Bulk** 2
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Hands** 2

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Type** Melee

**Category** Martial

**Group** [Polearm](/WeaponGroups.aspx?ID=11)
</row>

</column>

---

Derived from a farming tool used to mow down long grains and cereals, this weapon has a long wooden shaft with protruding handles, capped with a curved blade set at a right angle.

<title level="2">Critical Specialization Effects</title>

**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 283 <sup>4.0</sup>

Certain feats, class features, weapon runes, and other effects can grant you additional benefits when you make a Strike with certain weapons and get a critical success. This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.

[Click here for the full rules on Critical Specialization Effects](/Rules.aspx?ID=235).

<document level="2" id="weapon-group-11" />

<title level="2">Specific Magic Weapons</title>
[Bloodgorger Scythe](/Equipment.aspx?ID=3203)
name: Scythe
